Walter Warniaha

Experience with multiple programming languages and environments on multiple operating systems. Leadership skills in managing teams large and small, mentoring junior talent, maximizing engagement, cost reduction and productivity.

Experience

Assistant Vice President

Moody’s Investors Service

Helped everyone stay on track with their projects being the go-to developer on the team. Tackled the difficult to find issues that eluded other developers. Brought the latest developments and standards in the industry to the team.

  • Designed, implemented “Integration Test Suite” for quick resolution of configuration/system issues in complex interrelated systems. Reduced deployment diagnosis time from 20% of team time to a few minutes.
  • Team lead responsible for technical review and guidance for new feature development and code reviews. Scrum master for a large agile team. Guided team to implement tasks, resolve obstacles, and schedule agile ceremonies. Mentor and assess junior developer performance and improvement strategies.
  • Created a new developer learning guide using Confluence to accommodate the frequent contract changes and high turnover rates for developers. New additions to the development team were quickly available for implementing stories.
    • Developed PowerShell scripts for installing all prerequisites for developer workstations/servers reducing the complex manual setup procedures from 5 days to a few hours.
  • Utilized Jenkins for automated builds and development server deployments.
  • Added Boost C++ stacktrace capabilities and dump file creation for quick identification of COM+ service issues resulting in a significant improvement in service up-time.
  • Recommend and Implemented strategies for applying unit tests and integration tests.
  • Significant performance improvements were achieved by caching validation results within service calls. Average debt rating validations resulted in an improvement in processing time from 10 minutes to 6 seconds.
  • Maintenance & Enhancements: Regulatory, Dodd-Frank, Brexit, IssuerNotification, Reliability, conversion to Docker
Oct 2011 – March 2021

Senior C++/C# Developer

Credit Suisse
  • Margin calculation enhancements: Option P&L slide logic was enhanced to provide multiple scenarios per portfolio. Improved rounding accuracy when calculating for the most optimal hedging scenario. Rounding errors were causing non-optimal option hedging.
  • Reliability: Dramatically improved up-time, decreasing support needs. Corrected poor multithreaded programming and improper use of STL collection classes that caused nighttime jobs to fail daily and require manual intervention.
  • Crystal Reports/CSV exports: Enhanced reports for PortfolioMargin account aggregate requirements, Margin swing exception reports, Account excess statements and Client margin statements.
  • Margin Support: Provided effective technical support. Team members were responsible for one week of support – round robin across all team members. Support requirements took up about 5% of the time.
  • Audit compliance: Compliance with an audit requirement was achieved by ensuring all positions were accounted for within each account’s portfolio. Should a position be missed or have a different quantity after calculation, an email was automatically sent to the support team for further investigation.
  • Process improvements: Automated build/install, Web/App Server configuration utility,
  • Visual Studio upgraded from VC6 to 2008.
Sep 2009 – Sep 2011

Senior Software Engineer

Passlogix, Inc.

v-GO SM, Passlogix’s secure kiosk product allowing users to securely access their applications without exposing sensitive data. Applications from one user are not accessible by any other user on that computer.

  • Secure Multi-User Sessions: In previous versions, any new user would cause a logout and close other user sessions. Added the capability for v-GO SM to allow multiple concurrent user sessions where user’s applications are hidden from one another to ensure security.
  • Transparent screen lock: In a hospital environment, doctors and nurses needed the ability to view a locked computer’s screen without the need to logon to that workstation. Designed and implemented a solution that was well under budget and completed ahead of schedule.
  • Technical Support: Provided effective and consistent technical support. Researched and implemented technical solutions with customers.

Single Sign-on – v-GO SSO, Passlogix’s industry leading product that provides client side logon capabilities automating all password management tasks including logon and password change, and providing single sign-on to web sites, Windows applications, mainframe emulators and Java applications without the need for these applications to call or utilize any APIs.

  • Performance enhancements: Response times for v-GO Single Sign-on were unacceptable due to performance requirements of one second. Response times were dramatically improved by identifying key optimization candidates using performance monitoring tools.
  • Smart-card Authenticator: Designed and implemented Smart-card authenticator using Windows CAPI.
  • Storage Manager: Designed a multi-process data store forcing all processes to utilize the same address space allowing the shared memory to be distributed via a heap.
  • Mainframe Helper Object: Redesigned v-GO Single Sign-On access to mainframe applications to utilize a data-driven solution that supported a much wider range of mainframe emulators significantly reducing the requirement to involve developers in critical support resolution scenarios. This allowed field engineers to instantly support new mainframe emulators.
  • Command prompt HLLAPI driver: Quickly designed a HLLAPI based driver for cmd.exe to accept Single Sign-on requests. This involved injecting a DLL into cmd.exe and utilizing the same DLL from within three different processes.
  • Resolved frequent crashes: Added a crash handler that would report faults and stack traces in the application and allow the application to continue running. These stack traces were monumental in diagnosing customer reported defects that could not be reproduced in-house.
Feb 2003 – Jun 2009

Senior Application Developer

Citibank N.A./Software Innovations, Inc.

CitiDirect, Citibank’s premier corporate banking application written in Java and C++.

  • Data Access Layer (DAL): Component designed to use hard coded classes to represent logical data definitions consisting of multiple tables and a hard coded where clause. Redesigned to move the data definitions to tables within the database which allowed for more rapid development. Definitions of SQL tables were stored in DAL tables which were used to construct SQL statements.
  • Java Data Access Layer (JDAL): When Microsoft was unable to continue supporting Java, the C++ DAL was rewritten in Java 2 using JDBC.
  • Entitlements Engine: Utilizing the DAL, all database access incorporated entitlements checking into their workflow by enabling an entitlements flag, reducing programming effort on the entire project.
  • Performance: Analyzed performance of server threads and implemented changes to reduce response times.
  • Crash/Hang analysis: Performed server-side crash/hang analysis utilizing “Debugging Tools for Windows”.

NCB (New CitiBanking), Citibank’s legacy corporate banking application written in C++ and C. This system was deployed at the customer desks and was used to capture cash, securities, corporate actions, trade, and cross border payment transactions.

  • Broadcast Manager: Designed and implemented “Broadcast Manager”, a user alerting mechanism for notifying all users running the application of an important event.
  • Input Message Handler: Co-developed and enhanced a SWIFT message handler. Each message was associated to a handler DLL that was loaded, processed the message, and unloaded awaiting the next message.
  • Peer-to-peer Messaging: Designed and implemented an instant messaging component.
  • Frameworks: Maintained and enhanced frameworks used by “New CitiBanking”.
  • Trade Front-end: Participated in the development of a Trade application providing “Letter of Credit” functionality.
May 1994 – Dec. 2002

Interests

Apart from being a developer, I enjoy playing 8-ball and 9-ball plaing on leagues and recreationally. I ride a Harley Davidson Wide Glide and love the sharp turns throughout Harriman State Park. I especially enjoy the fall when the leaves begin to change color. In the winter, I like to go snowboarding and always enjoy a smooth carve. While on vacations in the Carribean, I always try to do a few scuba dives with Eden Rock in the Cayman Islands being my favorite dive location. I also love dogs, with Vizslas being my faviorite breed.

I also like to spend my free time giving back to the community and volunteer as an Emergency Medical Technician. I find extreme satisfaction in being able to help people.
